title: Automation QA Engineer IRC265913
description:
**Description**
 Eurpoean leader of location services with whom GlobalLogic has been cooperating for more than 10 years
   

  

 At GlobalLogic, we prioritize innovation and collaboration, crafting an environment where your skills will flourish. As an Automation QA Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in a broad range of responsibilities, from hands-on hardware experience to setting up automation frameworks. This is an outstanding opportunity to work with world-class technologies and contribute to groundbreaking projects with a proven leader in location services.
   

  

 Location: Södertälje / Stockholm
   

  

**Requirements**
 Senior Automation QA Engineer should have:
   

  

  

* Experience in QA Automation, particularly with Java
* Hands-on experience working with hardware to be able to test navigation on the road
* Knowledge of maps and navigation systems
* Ability to drive a truck and gather navigation data (truck license is a big plus)
* Proven track record of setting up automation frameworks
* Excellent communication skills to liaise between clients
* Experience with maps/navigation
* Ambitious and determined to successfully implement solutions


 Job responsibilities
   

  

 You will empower the testing team and bring your experience in test automation to help with bulding automation frameworks.
   

  

  

* Setting up processes and frameworks for automation
* Working with HW, specifically testing navigation on the road
* Driving the truck as a passenger and gathering navigation data logs
* Communicating effectively between two clients to ensure seamless collaboration
* Gathering feedback from engineers to continuously improve the systems


 What we offer
   

  

**Culture of caring.** 
 At GlobalLogic, we prioritize a culture of caring. Across every region and department, at every level, we consistently put people first. From day one, you’ll experience an inclusive culture of acceptance and belonging, where you’ll have the chance to build meaningful connections with collaborative teammates, supportive managers, and compassionate leaders.
   

  

**Learning and development.** 
 We are committed to your continuous learning and development. You’ll learn and grow daily in an environment with many opportunities to try new things, sharpen your skills, and advance your career at GlobalLogic. With our Career Navigator tool as just one example, GlobalLogic offers a rich array of programs, training curricula, and hands-on opportunities to grow personally and professionally.
   

  

**Interesting & meaningful work.** 
 GlobalLogic is known for engineering impact for and with clients around the world. As part of our team, you’ll have the chance to work on projects that matter. Each is a unique opportunity to engage your curiosity and creative problem-solving skills as you help clients reimagine what’s possible and bring new solutions to market. In the process, you’ll have the privilege of working on some of the most cutting-edge and impactful solutions shaping the world today.
   

  

**Balance and flexibility.** 
 We believe in the importance of balance and flexibility. With many functional career areas, roles, and work arrangements, you can explore ways of achieving the perfect balance between your work and life. Your life extends beyond the office, and we always do our best to help you integrate and balance the best of work and life, having fun along the way!
   

  

**High-trust organization.** 
 We are a high-trust organization where integrity is key. By joining GlobalLogic, you’re placing your trust in a safe, reliable, and ethical global company. Integrity and trust are a cornerstone of our value proposition to our employees and clients. You will find truthfulness, candor, and integrity in everything we do.
   

  

**About GlobalLogic**
 GlobalLogic, a Hitachi Group Company, is a trusted digital engineering partner to the world’s largest and most forward-thinking companies. Since 2000, we’ve been at the forefront of the digital revolution – helping create some of the most innovative and widely used digital products and experiences. Today we continue to collaborate with clients in transforming businesses and redefining industries through intelligent products, platforms, and services.

title: GCP Data Engineer Stockholm

 Nexer Insight invites you to embark on a journey as a

description:

**Ditt team**
 Du kommer bli en del av ett prestigelöst team som består av Agile Product Owner, Team Coach, Testare och Frontend- och Backendutvecklare. Tillsammans ansvarar vi för att vidareutveckla och förvalta Handelsbankens interna web-applikationer och systemlösningar. Vårt mål är att skapa användarvänliga lösningar som visualiserar kundengagemang och kundinteraktioner på ett effektivt sätt. Vi stöttar medarbetare genom att tillhandahålla innovativa lösningar som gör mötena smidigare och mer värdeskapande. Genom ett nära samarbete med kontoren säkerställer vi att verktygen möter både användarnas och affärens behov. Teamet präglas av hög kompetens och bred erfarenhet, både inom teknik och affärsverksamhet. Vi har kul och samarbetar tätt för att lösa problem tillsammans.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som Tech Lead javautvecklare kommer du spela en central roll i utvecklingen av våra grundläggande tjänster i våra interna kundmötesplatser där vi hanterar kund- och administrativa ärenden. Tillsammans med teamet och våra arkitekter kommer du att driva nyutvecklingen och säkerställa att våra system är både hållbara och effektiva. Du kommer även ansvara för att hantera och lösa incidenter som kan uppstå samtidigt som du ser till att systemen underhålls och livscykelhanteras kontinuerligt. Du kommer också att vara en central kontaktperson för olika stakeholders och ha möjlighet att påverka hur lösningarna ska byggas och utvecklas. Rollen ger dig möjlighet och mandat att forma och utveckla våra tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har gedigen erfarenhet av utveckling i Java. Du har goda kunskaper inom systemutveckling och känner dig bekväm med att arbeta självständigt i komplexa system. Din tekniska bakgrund har givit dig erfarenhet av att ta ett helhetsansvar för utvecklingsområdet i din roll. Vidare har du erfarenhet av integrationer, gärna mot Salesforce. Vi ser också att du har arbetat med testautomatisering tidigare, exempelvis med READy API, integrationstester och unit tester. Du har förmåga att kritiskt granska både din egen och andras kod för att säkerställa hög kvalitet. Då vi samarbetar med hela koncernen behöver du goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.
   

  

 Vi ser även att du har:
   

  

* Kunskap inom verktyg som Git (Bitbucket), databaser, JSON, och/eller TeamCity.
* Erfarenhet av ramverk som JAX-RS, JPA, JTA och JMS.


 Vi söker dig som trivs med att arbeta i team där vi ställer upp för varandra och delar med oss för att nå gemensamma mål. Det kommer naturligt att tänka i nya banor för att komma fram till skalbara lösningar. Vidare trivs du med att lösa komplexa uppgifter genom att samla in relevant information, analysera den noggrant och fatta välgrundade beslut utifrån ett helhetsperspektiv. Eftersom systemen är kritiska för Handelsbanken är det även viktig att du är noggrann i ditt arbete och har förmåga att anpassa ditt arbetssätt och prioriteringar.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet av JavaScript, Typescript och ReactJS.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Vi erbjuder**
* en trygg och stabil arbetsgivare
* dynamiskt och stimulerande arbete
* work-life balance
* kompetens- och karriärutveckling
* inkluderande och jämställd arbetsmiljö
* konkurrenskraftigt förmånspaket


**Kontaktuppgifter**
**Rekryterande chef:** 
 Niklas Malmström, niklas.malmstrom@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**TA Partner:** 
 Alva Jonerot, alva.jonerot@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Finansförbundet:**
 Per Almshult, per.almshult@handelsbanken.se
   

  

**Facklig representant Akademikerföreningen:** 
 Paul Gutesten, paul.gutesten@handelsbanken.se

title: Marknadskoordinator
description:
### **Är du vår nya lagspelare till vårt försäljnings- och marknadsteam?**

  

Vi på **ELME Spreader** **AB** letar efter dig som vill vara med och stärka vår marknadskommunikation – så att våra produkter och vårt varumärke syns där de ska, på rätt sätt och i rätt sammanhang. Tillsammans ser vi till att ELME fortsätter vara ett starkt och tydligt namn inom branschen.


Vi är ett team som jobbar tätt ihop, både inom marknad och med andra delar av företaget. Nu behöver vi en ny kollega som har koll på hur man sprider information via branschmedier, LinkedIn och andra sociala plattformar. Du är med och planerar, driver och genomför våra marknadsaktiviteter – alltid med stöd och samarbete från oss andra.


Vi hjälps åt med allt från PR och press till kundevent och mässor, där du ofta har en ledande roll i planeringen. Du har även kontakt med våra externa samarbetspartners som fotografer, reklambyråer, webbyråer och tryckerier.

### 

### **VAD VI TROR DU HAR MED DIG:**

  

Vi hoppas att du har en utbildning inom marknadsföring, kommunikation eller liknande. Har du jobbat i en liknande roll tidigare är det toppen – men du kan också vara ny i karriären. Eftersom vi är ett verkstadsindustriellt företag, är det ett extra plus om du har erfarenhet från tillverkande verksamhet.


Vi ser gärna att du har med dig kunskap inom:

* Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop)
* Sociala medier, särskilt LinkedIn, med fokus på B2B
* CMS för webbsidor
* Microsoft Office, framför allt PowerPoint, Word och Outlook
* Svenska och engelska – i både tal och skrift

  

Har du även koll på Account Based Marketing och sökmotoroptimering? Då blir vi extra glada.

### 

### **SÅ HÄR ÄR VI -OCH SÅ HOPPAS VI ATT DU ÄR:**

  

Hos oss är det viktigt med gemenskap, ansvarstagande och nyfikenhet. Vi tror att du är en kreativ person som gillar att testa nytt, har ett öga för form och färg och uppskattar struktur och tydlighet i vardagen. Du har lätt för att ta initiativ och ser helheten – men missar inte detaljerna.


Vi kommunicerar mycket både internt och externt, så det är viktigt att du känner dig trygg med att uttrycka dig i både tal och skrift. Framför allt söker vi en positiv kraft som trivs med att jobba tillsammans med andra.


Hos ELME får du en varierad vardag, frihet att forma din roll och många kontaktytor. Vi är ett engagerat team som stöttar varandra, har kul ihop och är stolta över det vi gör.

 **START:** Efter överenskommelse

**PLATS:** Älmhult

**OMFATTNING:** Heltid

**LÖN:** Fast lön

*Låter det som något för dig? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag.*


I denna rekryteringen samarbetar Elme Spreader med FSK . Ansvariga rekryterare är Theresia Andersson.


Ansök på www.fskpeople.se



Tjänst
Marknadskoordinator
Omfattning
Ort
Älmhult
Sista ansökningsdag
2025-07-04

title: Data Analyst
description:
Luton, GBR Zaventem, BE; Rijswijk, NL; Stockholm, SE; Hannover, DE; Hybrid Permanent Full Time Varies dependent on experience 133360
At TUI, we’re on a mission to become the most digital, data-driven travel company in the world. Our Airline Data Science & Analytics team plays a key role in that journey—delivering innovative data solutions and accelerating digital maturity across our global airline operations.


We’re looking for a Data Analyst who’s passionate about solving complex problems, uncovering insights, and driving business impact through data. If you’re a curious thinker, a strong collaborator, and thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment—this could be your next adventure.


We are happy to consider this opportunity on a hybrid working model basis in line with local office attendance requirements. International travel should be expected so flexibility is required in this regard.


The role will be published until 11th July 2025.

**ABOUT OUR OFFER**

* **Personal benefits**: Attractive remuneration, discretionary bonus schemes, generous travel benefits, extensive health & well-being support, and more.
* **Flexible working**: Work is something you do, not somewhere you go. We encourage a healthy work-life balance with a dynamic working environment.
* **A career to shape**: Access the TUI Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
* **Broaden your network:** We champion intercultural collaboration and provide opportunities to work on global projects and teams
* **Community**: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation.

**ABOUT THE JOB**

* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define business problems and translate them into analytical solutions.
* Break down complex challenges, identify relevant data sources, and deliver high-quality data products and dashboards.
* Dive deep into cloud databases and data pipelines to extract, transform, and analyse data using SQL and Python.
* Present insights through compelling storytelling and data visualizations that drive decision-making.
* Support the development of predictive models and machine learning solutions.
* Automate recurring manual data tasks
* Contribute to agile delivery by writing user stories, acceptance criteria, and participating in sprint planning.

**ABOUT YOU**

* Strong analytical mindset and experience with large datasets and exploratory data analysis.
* Proficiency in SQL and Python (Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn).
* Solid understanding of statistical concepts and data modelling.
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
* Familiarity with cloud data platforms and enterprise data warehouse structures.
* Ability to communicate complex findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Hands-on experience in tools like Alteryx, Power Query, or other low-code/no-code data automation platforms is a plus
* A good understanding of agile/lean software delivery methodology, tools and techniques and the software development lifecycle including knowledge of Scrum and Kanban
* A continuous learner who thrives in ambiguity and takes ownership of their work.


From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.


We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

**Security Clearance Statement**


At TUI, safety is our top priority. We conduct thorough background checks on all employees who join our Airline. Rest assured; we’ll guide you on the necessary information you need to provide at each stage.


Please note that if you are applying for a role in the UK, **you must ensure you can provide a full 5 years referencing, plus a criminal record check for all countries you’ve resided in for more than 6 months in the past 5 years** (some costs may apply).

title: Key Account Manager - Public sector
description:
**Epassi** 
**is an innovative fintech company, our** 
**purpose is to boost everyday well-being** 
 .
   

  

 We are the market leader in mobile payments for employee benefits in Northern Europe – our solution combines all the benefits into a single mobile app. Epassi’s team is made of highly skilled people from top notch business developers, designers and software engineers to passionate sales, marketing, and customer support professionals. Epassi is awarded by the Financial Times as one of the fastest growing companies in Europe.
   

  

**Epassi expands outside of the Nordics!**
 We have recently acquired the UK's largest health and fitness network
 **Incorpore,** 
 leading Italian corporate welfare and employee benefits company
 **Eudaimon** 
 as well two of the leading corporate fitness companies in Western Europe,
 **Hansefit** 
 in Germany &
 **BFNL** 
 in Netherlands.
   

  

**Epassi’s purpose is to boost everyday well-being** 
 . We are the market leader in mobile payments for employee benefits in Northern Europe – our solution combines all the benefits into one mobile app. Epassi’s team is made of highly skilled people from top notch business developers, designers and software engineers to passionate sales, marketing and customer support professionals. Epassi is awarded by the Financial Times as one of the fastest growing companies in Europe.
   

  

 As a
 **Key Account Manager,** 
 you play a key role in managing and developing relationships with our customers, primarily within the public sector. The main objective of the role is to drive growth within your own portfolio by increasing service utilization, expanding the number of users, and generating higher revenues.
   

  

 The team also holds overall responsibility for maximizing Epassi’s sales performance, revenue, and customer profitability, reducing churn, and enhancing customer satisfaction among existing customers within the Mid – X large segment across all of Epassi’s products.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities**
* Manage and develop relationships with customers in your own portfolio
* Drive strategic customer development and establish long-term partnerships
* Ensure the delivery of Epassi's services and proactively work with customer care
* Actively visit customers and proactively influence and guide upcoming procurements by educating and challenging customers and municipalities before a procurement process is formally initiated
* Identify and execute upselling opportunities for additional services and new users
* Actively work with reference-based sales by leveraging satisfied existing customers to attract new business
* Collaborate cross-functionally internally to address customer needs and challenges
* Influence and engage key stakeholders both internally and externally


**Main Qualifications**
* 3–5 years of proven successful experience in a similar role
* 2–3 years of experience working with the public sector
* Experience working with complex service offerings
* Experience working with HR is a plus
* Strong communication skills in both Swedish and English, both spoken and written
* Solid understanding of SaaS business models and customer success


**Why you should work with us...**
* Be part of a fast-growing international company with a meaningful mission: Boosting everyday wellbeing. At work. At home. Everywhere.
* Work in a flexible, collaborative environment and be part of the Key Account Management team.
* Get the possibility to implement your ideas and take ownership of change, to develop your needed competencies you get a yearly funding
* We offer a flexible hybrid setup (3 days office / 2 days remote), a collaborative culture, and the freedom to shape your role and make a real impact.
* At our centrally located office in Stockholm & Trollhättan, wellbeing and community matters: from Tuesday breakfasts and meditation sessions to a weekly yoga class and running club.
* We use the Epassi well-being benefits & lunch card and keep the office stocked with snacks, drinks, and fresh fruit.
* We’re ambitious and move fast — which means room to grow, try things out, and learn quickly. While not everything is perfectly structured, you’ll be part of a team that values trust, openness, and real work-life balance (no glorified overtime here).
* We offer a competitive compensation package, we offer pension AND insurances as part of having a collective agreement and mental health support through Auntie in case your personal or private life gets more stressful than usual.

title: SAP SCM consultant to Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group
description:
Do you have a passion for transforming businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies? Are you looking for a place where you could combine your business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how? Then our roles as SAP consultant in our Technology practice are a perfect find for you!
   

  

 Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity. Take this opportunity to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career. You will play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!
   

  

**About Our SAP Nordics Practice**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As a leading business partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation, to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business.
   

  

 We are market leading with SAP in the Nordics with close collaboration and a long-lasting relationship. We drive multiple major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies. Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 Accenture is not only leading with Technology but also functional expertise. If you are experienced in Finance, Supply Chain, Procurement or HR – you will find peers to develop together with.
   

  

 And, as we know – Data and Analytics is further key expertise we are looking for.
   

  

 We have a strong sustainability agenda. As advisors, innovators and solution developers, we help clients define and enable sustainability strategies – reduce carbon footprints, for example, or curb waste – and, at the same time, create new sources of value for the business.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking at candidates for several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at
   

  

 https://www.accenture.com/se-en/services/sap-index.
   

  

**What’s in it for you:**
- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects.

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects.

- Significant development opportunities and support for progressing in your professional career.

- Rich opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills.

- Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert network and benchmarks.

- A dedicated mentor to guide you during your work with continuous feedback.

- Being part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment.

- Utilize your functional and technical expertise in SAP Supply Chain and other, by analyzing, designing, and implementing business processes supported by SAP best practice solutions.

- Utilize your Industry expertise in the field of SAP solutions to deliver client value as a professional individual and as part of a team.

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery.

- Competitive compensation and benefits.

- Help clients’ sustainability agenda through SAP transformations.

- Be a valuable member of our Nordic SAP Supply Chain team and contribute to thought leadership, competence development, and sales initiatives.

**Qualifications**
**About our SAP SCM Practice**
 Our SAP Supply Chain Management practice is the largest in the industry, a great community of colleagues, and a key area of focus for our clients. Accenture has an extensive footprint in the Nordics within Retail, Industrial Equipment, Consumer Goods, Automotive, and Chemicals. An optimized Supply Chain is critical in all those segments, in particular under the current dynamic market conditions.
   

  

 Our team and services cover notably:
   

  

  

- Supply Chain Planning, leveraging SAP solutions such as IBP, S/4HANA Advanced Planning, and S/4HANA Advanced ATP

- Supply Chain Execution, including Warehousing (EWM), Transportation (TM), Global Trade Services (GTS), and Logistics Business Networks (LBN)

- Manufacturing, including S/4HANA Manufacturing, S/4HANA Quality Management, Digital Manufacturing Cloud (DMC) and Product Lifecycle Management solutions (PLM)

- Digital Asset Management, including S/4HANA Plant Maintenance and Asset Intelligence Network (AIN)

 If you love material flows, shop floor processes, or warehouse optimization, our team is a great home for you!
   

  

**Who we are looking for:**
**Required Qualifications**
- Min. 2+ years of hands-on SAP experience in one or more of the above mentioned areas, preferably in the Nordic region

- Hands-on Supply Chain experience from S/4HANA solutions

- Good understanding of Supply Chain process and their business value drivers

- Strong resonance with Accenture core values

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Motivated, persistent, eager to optimize, drive for excellence

- Passionate about SAP, innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Effectively work with cross-functional teams/stakeholders in an international and fast-moving environment

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility, and team player

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source, and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Preferred Qualifications**
- Experience in at least one S/4HANA or Digital Supply Chain Cloud solution implementation

- An SAP certification

- Experience across the full lifecycle, including estimating, planning, and delivering a solution end-to-end

- Deep business and industry experience in one or more of the industries

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken
